intro: Blepharochilum macphersonii, commonly known as the MacPherson's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically visited by bees and other pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open prairies and rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
